alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 11:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Showers with strong wind gusts will impact portions of Boyd, Greenup, Lawrence, Carter, Lawrence, central Cabell, northwestern Mingo, Lincoln and Wayne Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1100 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Head of Grassy to Piso. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts of 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Portsmouth, Ironton, Grayson, Louisa, Coal Grove, Olive Hill, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Lake Vesuvius, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park and Barboursville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 159 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
